questions.question: what are the main stages of the project life cycle?
what is Errors Classification?
answers: Information for the user of errors in the system
Errors that may have different impact on the software

questions.question: what are the 4 basic parts of Design Pattern?
answers: Name & Consequences and trade-offs of application
Name & Problem & Solution & Consequences and trade-offs of application

questions.question: What is the main advantage of the Agile approach compared to traditional development models (e.g., Waterfall)?
answers: Complete documentation is written at the beginning of the project
Dynamic adaptation of requirements throughout the development cycle
Parallel development of all product stages

questions.question: How often are Scrum meetings held in Agile methodology?
answers: Only at the end of each Sprint

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of functional requirements?
answers: Requirements that describe actions or services the system should provide

questions.question: Which of the following describes a non-functional requirement?
answers: The system will allow adding a new user
The systemâ€™s response time will not exceed two seconds
The user can save the file in PDF format
The system will enable daily automatic backups

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using closed-ended questions in surveys?
answers: Comprehensive answers to all aspects of the question

questions.question: What is one of the main challenges in creating an effective survey?
answers: Shortening the time required to complete the survey

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of design patterns in software architecture?
answers: To provide proven solutions to recurring design problems
To increase the number of bugs

questions.question: What is the 'Separation of Concerns' principle in architecture?
answers: Combining all functions into a single file
Dividing the system into independent modules with clear responsibilities
Developing all components by the same team

questions.question: What is one of the main goals of preventive software maintenance?
answers: Fixing existing bugs in the system
Preventing future failures and improving performance

questions.question: Which type of maintenance is performed when bugs are discovered after the system goes live?
